entries.title: Congress’s approval of legislation to force a public release of federal records tied to the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein has put new pressure on the Justice Department
The House Ethics Committee said Wednesday it was moving forward with an investigation into Rep. Cory Mills, an announcement that came just ahead of a potential censure vote on the Florida Republican
Trump is restarting attacks on states trying to regulate artificial intelligence, calling for Congress to pre-empt such laws while weighing an executive order
President Trump’s appointed EEOC chair, Andrea Lucas, is shifting the agency’s priorities to fighting anti-Christian bias and diversity programs. And now she has the power to do more.
President Trump said he would meet with Zohran Mamdani at the White House on Friday at the New York mayor-elect’s request
The House voted to repeal a controversial Senate-crafted provision—part of the legislation that ended the government shutdown—that could grant some GOP senators $500,000 in taxpayer-funded damages
President Trump signed legislation authorizing the Justice Department to release files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein

By feting Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, President Trump pivots once again to foreign policy—and triggers concerns from some Republicans that he isn’t putting more focus on the high cost of living
U.S. Appeals Court Halts California Rule Mandating Climate Risk Reporting
Congress overwhelmingly approved legislation Tuesday mandating the disclosure of a trove of government files related to sex offender Jeffrey Epstein
Calley Means, a confidant to Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., will take on a role as a bridge between the Make America Healthy Again movement and President Trump’s broader MAGA coalition
U.S. elections are sending a consistent message: Americans are deeply frustrated with their government’s inability to solve problems
Middle-class voters, many of them frustrated with MAGA and President Trump, could be up for grabs in next year’s midterms
Senate Republicans have tried to persuade their vulnerable Georgia colleague Jon Ossoff to join them in voting to reopen the government, to no avail
Republican Rep. Elise Stefanik, an ally of President Trump, announced a run for New York governor in next year’s election, challenging Democratic incumbent Gov. Kathy Hochul
In Charts: In Virginia and New Jersey gubernatorial elections, the working-class, Hispanic and Black neighborhoods that helped return Trump to the White House moved back to Democrats
Trump said the Saudi crown prince “knew nothing about” the 2018 murder of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi, though the CIA at the time assessed that the royal orchestrated the killing

A classified Justice Department brief authorizing strikes on drug-smuggling boats in the Caribbean and Pacific describes fentanyl as a potential chemical weapons threat, according to people familiar with the memo
A head-to-head comparison of unmanned aircraft shows the global rivals in a close race
Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said that the Pentagon will shake up the way it buys weaponry, equipment and software by making purchases more quickly—and from a broader range of potential suppliers.

The Trump administration is still deciding whether to push Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro out of power or extract concessions from him, according to U.S. officials familiar with the deliberations
